title: Question 3
prompt: Based on the events in this poem, what would be most likely to happen if the narrator had not told his friend about his anger?
description: Click the <u>one best answer</u> to each question.
feedback:
In the first stanza, the narrator compares his anger at his friend to his anger at his enemy. Because he tells his friend about his anger, his anger leaves him. Because he doesn’t tell his enemy about his anger, his anger only became worse. If he didn’t tell his friend about his anger, that anger would also likely become worse. His friend might then likely become an enemy.


I was angry with my friend.
I told my wrath, my wrath did end.
I was angry with my foe.
I told it not, my wrath did grow;
